a puzzle; a riddle; a conundrum - a) a problem or puzzle in the form of a question, statement, etc. so formulated that some ingenuity is required to solve or answer it; b) a question or problem having only a conjectural answer; c) an intricate and difficult problem.

ಒಗಟಾಗು ogaṭāgu to become a perplexing, confusing or nonplussing; to become a puzzle, riddle; or difficult to understand; ಒಗಟುಹಾಕು ogaṭu hāku to pose a puzzle, riddle (to another) (usu. as a challenge to solve it).

the raw (uncooked) areca-nut.
somewhat salty taste, as the water of some marshes near the sea or of unripe fruit; an astringent taste; brackishness.

to cause to come forth or be emitted.

to join or be joined harmoniously; to be proper, fitting (as a part in a whole).

in an extraordinary manner; extraordinarily.

to season (food) with sesame, curry leaves, asafoetida, etc. cooked in oil. 2) to exaggerate the facts to make them look more lively, interesting, exciting or bitter.

= ಒಡಮಱುಕ.
sympathetic consciousness of otherś distress together with a desire to alleviate it; compassion.
to show compassion; to be compassionate.
the physical frame of a human or an animal; the whole material organism; the body.
to turn suddenly to one side.
to cause to split or crack sharply into pieces; to smash; to shatter.
a kind of dish made by grinding coarsely Bengal dal (chicken pea, the gram of Cicer arientinum) with green chillies, salt etc.
to cause to turn back or return.
to cause to be manifested evidently; to depict clearly.
to become manifested evidently; to be depicted clearly.
wealth ornaments, belongings, etc. that one possesses.
to acquire wealth; to get ornaments.
to perform; to accomplish; to carry out.
to be possible.
to happen; to become.
to take upon oneself; to enter into; to undertake.

to perform; to accomplish; to carry out.
to make an attempt; to strive; to endeavour.
to commence; to start; to begin.
to cause to happen; to inflict.
to happen; to become; to befall.
to come; to move into a place.

physical or mental activity needed or exerted for achieving something; an effort.
to cause to happen, befall.
to begin; to commence.
to start; to commence; to begin.
to make an attempt; to strive; to try.
to do; to act; to perform.
to cause to happen.
to offer; to give; to submit.
to happen; to become.
to bring together; to accumulate; to heap up.
= ಒಡಲು.
to be a receptacle, resort for something.
to appear with a physical form.
one's son, as born from his or her body.
Manmata, the Love God and the personification of love (that is born from within).
Śiva, the enemy of Love-God Manmata.
to have a physical body; to manifest physically.
Manmata, the Love-God who does not have a body of his own.
the physical frame of a human or an animal; the whole material organism; the body.
the lower front part of the human body between the chest and thighs; the abdomen; the belly.

the central part of a sari (a garment worn by Hindu women, consisting of a long piece of cotton or silk wrapped around the body with one end draped over the head or over one shoulder) excluding the borders on all sides.
the body or frame of a ship, airship, flying boat, etc.; hull.

ಒಡಲಜರ oḍala jara fever within the body, not felt or realised by the person; ಒಡಲಪೊಗು oḍalapogu to take shelter under another's power, authority etc.; to seek protection from; ಒಡಲಮಾತು oḍala mātu the inner feelings that is kept from others or confided to a close friend; ಒಡವೆರಸು oḍaverasu to cause to mix, mingle with. 2. to mix, mingle (oneself) with; ಒಡವೆರೆ oḍavere to mix, mingle (oneself) with; to be associated with; ಒಡಲವೆಱು oḍalaveṛu to manifest with a physical form; to have a body; ಒಡಲನಿಕ್ಕು oḍalanikku to throw away one's body; to die; ಒಡಲುವಿಡಿ oḍaluviḍi to protect one's body; to escape from death; ಒಡಲುಹೊರೆ oḍalu hore to do something just to have one's minimum and basic requirements as food, cloth, etc. ಒಡಲೆರಡು, ಉಸಿರೊಂದು oḍalereḍu, usirondu perfect oneness of opinions, vision, etc. (between two persons) ; a true friend is one soul in two bodies; ಒಡಲೊಳಗಿಟ್ಟುಕೊ oḍaloḷagiṭṭuko to keep or guard as, a secret; ಒಡಲುರಿ ಒಂದು ಕಡೆ, ಬ್ರಹ್ಮೇತಿ ಒಂದು ಕಡೆ oḍaluri ondu kaḍe, brahmēti ondu kaḍe suffering from inner trouble, adding to it is the external problem.
= ಒಡಲ್ಗಿಚ್ಚು.
to take a physical form.
to appear in a physical form.
= ಒಡಲ್ಗಿಚ್ಚು.
he who burns a (dead) body to ashes.
he who inflicts pain, agony, on others.
to burn a body.
to give or cause pain, anxiety, anguish, etc.
to take a physical body; to get a tangible form.
to attach more importance to the physical life (contrary to spiritual one).
he who lives to indulge eating, and is engaged only in earning his bread.
the food eaten to one's full satisfaction, to fill the belly fully.
a mark, scar one the body.
the heat or feeling of irritation within the body as from fever or disease, anxiety or worry.
a feeling of discontent and ill-will because of another's advantages, possessions, etc.; resentful dislike of another who has something that one desires; envy.
Manmata, the love-god who has lost his body.
to cause food, medicine etc. ( that is taken in) absorbed into the body properly.
the lustre of the body.
a kind of tree.
to have immediately; to get or possess immediately.
to come along with or following immediatelyn someone or something.
= ಒಡವಾರ.
to flow together with another stream.
to cause to enter into (along with).
= ಒಡವರ್.
to spread, diffuse all over immediately.
(one's) age that is same as of another.
